basic.description:
Understanding biogeochemical cycles is key to understanding earth systems science. This course examines the processes behind the transfer and transformation of biogeochemical elements (e.g. carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus, sulfur, contaminants) between various Earth systems, and explores the methods used to quantify biogeochemical cycles.
NOTE    Field trip fees may apply in certain years.
LEARNING HOURS    126 (36L;84P)
basic.subject: GPHY
basic.title: Biogeochemical Processes

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite  Lvl 4 &(6 units fr MATH at the 100 lvl or above) &(6 units fr BIOL or CHEM or PHYS @the 100-lvl or above) &(a GPA of 1.90 in 30 units fr GPHY) &(reg in GPHY Maj or EGPY), or by petition to the Departmental Undergraduate Committee.
